result.reason: When RedirectKeys is enabled, KeyboardHookMode=1 sends Alt+Tab to the remote server, preventing local task switching to the fullscreen RDP session; the fullscreen toolbar or a keyboard hook escape mechanism is needed
result.approach: Add handling so that when RDP is in fullscreen mode, either the fullscreen toolbar provides a clickable way to release focus, or implement a configurable keyboard shortcut (e.g. Ctrl+Alt+Break which is standard RDP escape) that toggles fullscreen off, allowing Alt+Tab to work locally. May also need to adjust KeyboardHookMode to mode 2 (hook only in fullscreen) as a user-configurable option.

attempts.raw_output:
Now I have enough context. The issue is about Alt+Tab not working to switch back to an RDP session in full screen. This relates to `KeyboardHookMode = 1` which sends all key combinations (including Alt+Tab) to the remote server when `RedirectKeys` is enabled. This is a known RDP behavior â€” when keyboard hooking redirects to the remote server, local Alt+Tab can't reach the session.
